intro: Nassauvia lagascae, commonly known as the desert broom, is a shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant has small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Nassauvia lagascae is adapted to arid environments, with a deep root system that allows it to survive in drought conditions.
